verses.verse: And as He passed on by, He saw a person, blind from birth.
And His students asked Him, saying, "Rabbi, who sinned, this person or his parents, that he would be born blind?"
Jesus answered, "Neither this person sinned, nor his parents, but it happened so that the actions of God might be shown in him.
It is necessary for Me to be working the actions of work of the One who sent Me while it is day. Night is coming when no one is able to be working.
Whenever I am in the world, I am a light of the world."
After He said these things, He spat on the ground, made mud from the spit, anointed the mud on the eyes of the blind person,
and said to him, "Go back, wash in the swimming pool of Siloam" (that is interpreted from Hebrew as "Having been sent out"). So he went off, washed, and came seeing.
So the neighbors and the people who saw him the prior time, that he was blind, were saying, "Isn't this the one sitting and begging?"
Others were saying, "This is him." But others, "He is like him." That person was saying, "I am him."
So they were saying to him, "How were your eyes opened?"

That person answered and said, "A person called Jesus made mud, anointed it on my eyes, and said to me, 'Go back into the swimming pool of the Siloam and wash.' When I went off and washed, I saw again."
They said to him, "Where is that Person?" He says, "I don't know."
They lead him to the Separatists (the person blind in the past).
It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
So again the Separatists also were asking him how he saw again. The person said to them, "He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see."

So some from the Separatists were saying, "This Person is not from the side of God because He does not keep the Sabbath." Others were saying, "How is a sinful person able to be doing these types of indicators?" And there was a split among them.
They say to the blind person again, "What do you say about Him, that He opened your eyes?" The person said, "He is a preacher."
So the Jewish leaders didn't trust this about him, that he was blind and saw again, until a certain time that they hollered for his parents, the parents of the person who saw again.
And they asked them, saying, "Is this your son whom you say that he was born blind? So how does he see now?"
His parents answered them and said, "We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
But how does he now see? We do not know. Or who opened his eyes? We do not know. He has the age. Ask him. He will speak concerning himself."

His parents said these things because they feared the Jewish leaders. You see, the Jewish leaders were already agreeing that if anyone acknowledged Him as the Anointed King, he would become excommunicated from the synagogue.
Because of this, his parents said, "He has the age. Ask him."
So from a second time they hollered for the person who was blind and said to him, "Give magnificence to God. We know that this Person is sinful."
So that person responded and said, "If He is sinful, I do not know. One thing I know, that I, being a blind person, now see."
They said to him again, "What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?"
He answered them, "I already told you, and you did not listen. Why do you want to be listening to it again? You don't also want to become His students, do you?"
So they put him down and said, "You are a student of that Person, but we are students of Moses.
We know that God has spoken to Moses, but this Person, we don't know where He is from."
The person responded and said to them, "You see, in this is an amazing thing, that you don't know where He is from, and He opened my eyes.
We know that God doesn't listen to sinful people, but if anyone is God-worshipping and does what He wants, He listens to this person.
From the span of time, it has not been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person who has been born blind.
If this Person wasn't from the side of God, He wasn't able to be doing anything."
They responded and said to him, "In sins you were born, the whole you, and you are teaching us?" And they threw him outside.
Jesus heard that they threw him outside. And when He found him, He said to him, "Do you trust in the Son of God?"
That person answered and said, "Who is He, Master, so that I might trust in Him?"
Jesus said to him, "You have both seen Him and the One speaking with you is that Son."
The person was declaring, "I trust, Master," and he bowed down to Him.
And Jesus said, "For judgment I came into this world so that the people not seeing may see and the people seeing might become blind."
And some from the Separatists heard these things (the ones who were with Him) and said to Him, "We are not also blind, are we?"
Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would not have sin. But now you say, 'We see.' So your sin stays."
